definition: to depict/to trace (a drawing)/to copy/to touch up

sentences.english: Her craftsmanship improved and she mastered her sketching techniques.
sentences.chinese: 她的手藝提高了，還熟練地掌握了草圖素描法。

sentences.english: he was skilful at sketching. Suddenly, Abe suggested to go skiing.
sentences.chinese: 他素描畫得很嫺熟，突然，艾貝提議去滑雪。

sentences.english: The sketch is all plastic arts foundation.
sentences.chinese: 素描是一切造型藝術的基礎。

sentences.english: Haywire pulls the sketchbook out from under the bunk and begins flipping through the pages.
sentences.chinese: Haywire從牀鋪下拿出了並翻閱一套素描本。

sentences.english: By age six, Yanni had made over 4,000 paintings and drawings.
sentences.chinese: 到6歲時，亞妮已經畫了4000多幅畫和素描。

sentences.english: I looked at the pen and ink drawings.
sentences.chinese: 我看了看那些用鋼筆畫的素描。

sentences.english: The picture was cleverly restored and showed up its original colouring.
sentences.chinese: 孩子在給一套素描畫着色。

sentences.english: Charcoal drawing teaching should build up the general concept and educate the comprehensive ability of art.
sentences.chinese: 素描教學應樹立整體觀，培養學生的綜合藝術能力。

sentences.english: I was sketching to show Xiao Yan what to get for my altar table.
sentences.chinese: 我以素描讓曉豔知道什麼是我佛桌要用的樣子。

sentences.english: It wasn't until 1997 that I found out this sketch had been one of Hou Yimin's.
sentences.chinese: 到1997年的時候我才知道這是侯一民的一張素描。

sentences.english: A basic understanding of anatomy is crucial to figure painting.
sentences.chinese: 瞭解解剖對人體素描是至關重要的。

sentences.english: As a basis of plastic arts, sketch is unique to the art of painting.
sentences.chinese: 素描作爲造型藝術的基礎，有其自身獨特的藝術魅力。

sentences.english: The charcoal effect simulates a charcoal artist's impression of the image.
sentences.chinese: 炭筆效果模擬出該圖像的素描畫。

sentences.english: To the untrained eye, the charcoal sketch looks worthless.
sentences.chinese: 對外行人來說，這炭筆素描看來毫無價值。

sentences.english: Mr. A finished the sketch not only effortlessly but also masterfully .
sentences.chinese: 先生完成了素描，不但不費力，而且很熟練。

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
to sketch from nature/to do a still life drawing
